content.description: Sit start with a right hand fist jam and left hand gaston. From there, pull up to a high left hand gaston edge, match the right hand next to it, reach an edge, gain the lip, and top it out using the steggie features.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine, the landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the east facing crack on Numen.

content.description:
Run On The Air climbs a featured arete on great rock. Despite being so featured, the holds are spaced in a manner that requires special attention.

Sit start on the rock with a good left hand sidepull on the north face and a right hand sloper-bump on the west face. From there, stand up on a right edge and fall into a right hand sidepull, bump the left hand up to a micro-pinch-edge, bring the feet along through the thin, gain a high left hand edge, bump the right hand up to a good sidepull, reach a glorious left hand pinch at the apex of the arete, crank on top using the generous holds.
content.protection: A pair of pads at least, preferably three. The landing is great, but there is a nasty rock that shares part of the landing.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Numen.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, climb straight up through edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. It has a great landing, but there is a rock just behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the center of Numen's northwest face.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand pinch on the arete. From there, get the feet up, gain the pinch above with the left hand, commit to the lip, and crank over the lip using the jugs.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the east arete of Numen.
